intro: Conyza amboinica, commonly known as the false dandelion, is an annual herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with hairy stems and serrated leaf margins. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a composite inflorescence, and it produces lightweight seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Conyza amboinica is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
